thread.title: The Campaign Trail

author: onlineeditor@nashuatelegraph.com (The Nashua Telegraph)
title: The Campaign Trail
text:
Thursday, October 22, 2015 The Campaign Trail 
The Telegraph is providing an update on appearances by 2016 presidential contenders who are visiting southern New Hamp­shire. Here's a look at the upcoming scheduled campaign appear­ances: Please sign up for as low as 36 cents per day to continue viewing our website. 
Digital subscribers receive Unlimited access to all stories from nashuatelegraph.com on your computer, tablet or smart phone. Access nashuatelegraph.com, view our digital edition or use our Full Access apps. Get more information at nashuatelegraph.com/fullaccess 
The Telegraph is providing an update on appearances by 2016 presidential contenders who are visiting southern New Hamp­shire. Here's a look at the upcoming scheduled campaign appear­ances: 
THURSDAY, OCT. 22 
U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham, a South Carolina Republican, will appear at the Greater Salem Chamber of Com­merce meet and greet beginning at 11:45 a.m. He will tour Resin Systems Corp. in Amherst at 1:45 p.m. later in the day. 
Ohio Gov. John Kasich, a Republican, will appear at a televised town hall in Hanover for MSNBC's "Morning Joe" with hosts Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski beginning at 2:30 p.m. 
Graham will appear at the Milford Oval Walk beginning at the Red Arrow Diner at 2:45 p.m. and later hold a town hall meeting at the Derry Public Library at 6:30 p.m. 
Kasich will appear at a town hall-style event in the Newport Sugar River Bank beginning at 6:30 p.m. 
FRIDAY, OCT. 23 
Former New York Gov. George Pataki, a Republican, will take part in a taped Candidate Cafe at the Airport Diner in Manchester beginning at 10:30 a.m. 
Kasich will hold a town hall meeting in Manchester at 10:30 a.m. and another in Milford at 12:30 p.m., which the campaign is calling a balanced budget town hall. 
Graham will tour Rokon in Rochester at 1:30 p.m. and later knock on doors with Bob Graham at his Milton home later in the afternoon before speaking at one of Scott Brown's No BS Backyard barbecues at the Betti's home on Wallis Road in Rye. 
SATURDAY, OCT. 24 
Graham will hold a town hall at the Peterborough Town Library beginning at 10:30 a.m. Top Jobs
